sense.name: small burning fragments of a substance
sense.examples: Sparks from the ship's smokestack fell on the deck, singing a few passengers. Rubbing flint pieces together will produce tiny sparks of combustion. Sparks from burning houses down the hill were spreading the fire farther uphill.

sense.name: an electric discharge
sense.examples: A spark ignites the combustion in the engine. Sparks flew from the wall socket when John plugged in the appliance.

sense.name: personality trait of animation, energy
sense.examples: His presence brought a spark to the otherwise staid office atmosphere. They felt a spark even on their first date.

sense.name: small amount of some characteristic
sense.examples: There was a spark of anger in her voice. THere hasn't been even a spark of interest in John's proposal. Add a spark of color to your living room with bright throws and pillows.
